name: Spaghetti and Meatballs
cookingSteps: Combine ground beef, egg, breadcrumbs, milk, garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Roll into small balls.
Fry the meatballs in a pan with a little oil until they are brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, cook garlic in some oil for 30 seconds. Add crushed tomatoes, herbs, salt, and pepper. Let it simmer for 10–15 minutes.
Put the meatballs back in the pan. Simmer for another 10–15 minutes until fully cooked.
Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water for 8–10 minutes. Drain the water.
Put spaghetti on a plate. Top with meatballs and tomato sauce. Optional: add grated cheese or herbs.

name: Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (e.g. peas, carrots, corn)
1 cup cooked chicken, shrimp, or tofu (optional)
cookingSteps: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add chopped onion and garlic. Cook until soft and fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Push the vegetables to the side and scramble the eggs in the empty space. Mix everything together.
Add the cooked rice and optional protein. Stir well to combine.
Pour in soy sauce and sesame oil. Stir-fry for a few more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

name: Chili con Carne
ingredients: Optional: 1 tsp cocoa powder or a square of dark chocolate
cookingSteps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and garlic. Cook until soft.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Stir in bell pepper and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Add tomato paste, chopped tomatoes, kidney beans, and spices.
Optional: Add cocoa powder or dark chocolate for depth of flavor.
Stir everything and bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook on low heat for 20–30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Hamburger
cookingSteps: Season the ground beef with salt and pepper. Form into 4 burger patties.
Heat a pan or grill over medium-high heat. Add a little oil or butter.
Cook the patties for about 3–4 minutes per side, or until desired doneness.
If using cheese, place a slice on each patty during the last minute of cooking to melt.
Toast the burger buns lightly in a pan or toaster.
Assemble the burgers: bottom bun, patty, toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles), sauces, and top bun.
Serve immediately with fries or salad.

name: Pho
ingredients: 200g thinly sliced beef (like sirloin or flank steak)
cookingSteps: Char the onion and ginger in a dry pan or over open flame until slightly blackened.
In a pot, combine broth, charred onion and ginger, star anise, cinnamon, and cloves. Simmer for 20–30 minutes.
Soak or cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Strain the broth, then add fish sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Place noodles in bowls. Top with thin slices of raw beef.
Pour hot broth over the beef to cook it instantly.
Serve with fresh herbs, bean sprouts, lime, and chili on the side.
